_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Big River Resources, L.L.C.

Big River Resources, L.L.C. is a newly constructed facility.  Many of the reports and information have only recently been developed.  Given that Big River Resources, L.L.C. is a new facility, there has been constant review and revisions to reports and information prior to the start up of the facility.  On the same note, there has never been a change in management.  The management is "new" and therefore, the "new" management was implemented with the construction of the facility. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Big River Resources, L.L.C. has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

Big River Resources, L.L.C.'s policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Big River Resources, L.L.C. ethanol plant is located near West Burlington, Des Moines County, Iowa.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Anhydrous Ammonia.  Big River Resources, L.L.C. has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 5.6 miles; due to the amount of ammonia stored on site.

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 97,200 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 5.6 miles from the center of the plant.  Residence homes are locate

d within this 5.6 mile radius.

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Program Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Big River Resources, L.L.C. has constructed a new ethanol facility and is subject to RMP upon delivery of substances onsite.

Emergency Response Program Information:

Big River Resources, L.L.C. ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC will be prepared and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  Big River Resources, L.L.C.'s corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.
A final pre-startup and review of the facility's emergency response plan will occur prior to startup.
